fswcore

Class CfeFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • fswcore.CfeFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CfeTblFile, CfeTblTxtFile, EsAppLogFile, EsCdsLogFile, EsErLogFile, EsSysLogFile, EsTaskLogFile, EvsAppInfoFile, EvsLogFile, SbMsgMapFile, SbPipeFile, SbRouteFile, TblRegLogFile

    public abstract class CfeFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class to represent/model a cFE file.

    Implementation Notes:

    • This code is compatible with pre-Java 7 SDK
    • See cfe_fs.h for cFE file header definitions
    • Assumes files will be short. In KBs not MBs
    Author:
    David McComas

    • Method Detail

      • formatDataStrings

        public void formatDataStrings(java.lang.String fileName)
        Format header and user data strings suitable for display.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Full path and filename of the FSW file

      • loadHdrStrOld

        protected void loadHdrStrOld()
        Load the header string array. The fileByteArray must be loaded prior to calling this method.

      • loadHdrStr

        protected void loadHdrStr()
        Load the header string array. The fileByteArray must be loaded prior to calling this method.

      • loadUserDataStr

        protected abstract void loadUserDataStr()
        This method is intended to simplify the needs of a GUI. Each derived file type defines this function to create a string that is suitable for a text block display. fileByteArray must be loaded prior to calling this method.

      • loadUserDataStrArray

        protected abstract void loadUserDataStrArray()
        This method is intended to simplify the needs of a GUI. Each derived file type defines this function to create a string array that is suitable for a GUI pair display. fileByteArray must be loaded prior to calling this method.

      • getFileByteArray

        public byte[] getFileByteArray()
        Returns the fileByteArray
        Returns:
        byte array containing cFE file data

        protected byte[] readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Read the given binary file and return its contents as a byte array.
        Parameters:
        Byte - array containing file data

      • readAndCloseStream

        protected byte[] readAndCloseStream(java.io.InputStream input)
        Read an input stream and return it as a byte array. This implementation works whether the source is a file or an input stream. The file is closed after it is read.
